answerText: "Grass"[10] "Grass" was written by this American poet who called Chicago a "Tool Maker, Stacker of Wheat," and wrote a celebrated two-volume biography of Abraham Lincoln.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 9 | 17 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The speaker of this poem questions "What place is this? Where are we now?" [10]  Identify this poem whose title entity exclaims "Pile the bodies high at Austerlitz and Waterloo./ Shovel them under and let me work."
